column4: how can i install ubuntu from an iso file without burning a cd
i installed kubuntu from the alternate cd ,and it never asked me to setup a passowrd,but now when i try to loging to it of course it is asking for a username/password
it asks you for a password when you install
did for me, I just installed it twice last night
i used the alternate cd as an iso on my hard drive when i was installing it
asks for your user name, user's name, password, confirm password
mine was not an iso, but I use the alternate cd for everything
i cant get into the system i installed
it also asks for your host name in the same few steps.
odd, sounds like you should reinstall it.  Because it WILL ask you those questions I just said.  If it did not, there may have been some problem during the install
what i do is boat from a flash drive
and let search for an kubuntu.iso that i have on my hd
regardless.  If you install from an iso that is downloaded from ubuntu, it will go through the exact process
